trans-unit.source: Search your library for a blue instant card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
A rare find, suitable for the most discerning collector.
Search your library for a card, then shuffle and put that card on top. You lose 2 life.
"I can tell you what you wish to know. But first, there is the matter of my fee."

trans-unit.resname: J18·3 | Nin, the Pain Artist | Card Name
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.resname: J18·3 | Nin, the Pain Artist | Card Text
trans-unit.source: {X}{U}{R}, {T}: Nin, the Pain Artist deals X damage to target creature. That creature's controller draws X cards.

trans-unit.resname: J18·3 | Nin, the Pain Artist | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: "Your body is a delicate instrument that tells me truths. These devices help me 'tune' that instrument."
{T}: Add one mana of any color in your commander's color identity. Sacrifice Commander's Sphere: Draw a card.
It harmonizes with the essence of its master.

Until your next turn, your life total can't change and you gain protection from everything. All permanents you control phase out. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. They phase in before you untap during your untap step.) Exile Teferi's Protection.
"Someday, when the world is safe again, my homeland will return."\n—Teferi

trans-unit.resname: J18·6 | Lord of Atlantis | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Other Merfolk get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

trans-unit.resname: J18·6 | Lord of Atlantis | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may draw a card unless that player pays {1}.
Friends teach what you want to know. Enemies teach what you *need* to know.
Exile a creature you control: Add X mana of any one color, where X is 1 plus the exiled creature's mana value. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.
Every predator is something else's prey.
